v.v: This is the word of Yahweh that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations.

For Egypt: “This is about the army of Pharaoh Necho, king of Egypt that was at Carchemish by the Euphrates river. This was the army that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon defeated in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah:
Get the small shields and the large shields ready, and go forward to fight.
Put the harness on the horses; mount up on the horses and take your stand with your helmets on;
What am I seeing here? They are filled with terror and are running away, for their soldiers are defeated.
the swift cannot run away, and the soldiers cannot escape.
Who is this who rises like the Nile, whose waters toss up and down like the rivers?
Egypt rises like the Nile, like rivers of water that rise and fall.
Go up, horses. Be angry, you chariots. Let the soldiers go out,
That day will be the day of vengeance for the Lord Yahweh of hosts, and he will avenge himself on his foes.
Go up to Gilead and obtain medicine, virgin daughter of Egypt.
The nations have heard of your disgrace. The earth is filled with your laments,

v: polish the spears and put on your armor.
They are running for safety and are not looking back. Terror is all around—this is Yahweh’s declaration—
They stumble in the north and fall beside the Euphrates River.
Egypt says, ‘I will go up and I will cover the earth. I will destroy cities and their inhabitants.
Cush and Put, men skillful with a shield, and Ludim, men skillful at bending their bows.’
The sword will devour and be satisfied. It will drink its fill of their blood. For there will be a sacrifice
to the Yahweh Lord of hosts in the northern land by the Euphrates River.
It is useless that you put much medicine on yourself. There is no cure for you.
for soldier stumbles against soldier; both of them fall together.”

v.v: This is the word that Yahweh told Jeremiah the prophet when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came and attacked the land of Egypt:
“Announce in Egypt, and proclaim it in Migdol, Memphis, and Tahpanhes.
Why are your mighty ones face-down on the ground? They will not stand, because I, Yahweh, have pushed them to the ground.
He increases the numbers of those who stumble. Each soldier falls against the next one. They are saying, ‘Get up. Let us go home.
They proclaimed there, ‘Pharaoh the king of Egypt is only a noise, one who has let his opportunity slip away.’
As I live—declares the King, whose name is Yahweh of hosts—
Pack for yourselves baggage to carry into exile, you who live in Egypt.
Egypt is a very beautiful young cow, but a stinging insect is coming from the north. It is coming.
The hired soldiers in her midst are like a fattened bull, but they will also turn away and run away.
Egypt hisses like a snake and crawls away, for her enemies are marching against her.
They will cut down the forests—this is Yahweh’s declaration—although it is very dense.
The daughter of Egypt will be made ashamed. She will be given into the hand of people from the north.”

v: ‘Take your station and prepare yourself, for the sword will devour those around you.’
Let us go back to our own people, to our native land. Let us leave this sword that is beating us down.’
someone will come like Mount Tabor and Mount Carmel by the sea.
For Memphis will become a waste, it will lie in ruins and no one will live there.
They will not stand together, for the day of their disaster is coming against them, the time of their punishment.
They are going toward her like woodcutters with axes.
For the enemies will be more numerous than locusts, unable to be counted.

v.v: Yahweh of hosts, the God of Israel, says, “See, I am about to punish Amon of Thebes, Pharaoh, Egypt and her gods, her kings the Pharaohs, and those who trust in them.

I am giving them into the hand of the ones seeking their lives, and into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and his servants. Then after this Egypt will be inhabited as in previous days—this is Yahweh’s declaration.

But you, my servant Jacob, do not fear. Do not be dismayed, Israel, for see, I am about to bring you back from far away, and your offspring from the land of their captivity. Then Jacob will return, find peace, and be secure, and there will be no one to terrify him.

You, my servant Jacob, do not fear—this is Yahweh’s declaration—for I am with you, so I will bring complete destruction against all the nations where I scattered you. But I will not destroy you completely. Yet I will discipline you justly and will certainly not leave you unpunished.”
